channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Taylor Swift did it again ‚Äî surprising economists who underestimate her impact
item.description: Taylor Swift continues to confound Wall Street as demand for her concerts swing economic data around.

item.title: Instagram is failing to crack down on hate speech against women politicians as elections near, advocacy group says
item.description: Instagram failed to remove toxic comments directed at U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris and other leading female politicians, the CCDH said in a report.

item.title: Stock futures are little changed ahead of key inflation report: Live updates
item.description: The modest move in futures comes after a broad rally for stocks on Tuesday.

item.title: This tiny cap is soaring after winning its appeal üí™

item.title: Wells Fargo strategist says investors may face 1995 rerun once Fed cuts rates
item.description: 1995 was a period when the Fed embarked on a rate-cut cycle that may have parallels to what the markets are expecting for September.

item.title: SpaceX repeatedly polluted waters in Texas this year, regulators found
item.description: SpaceX violated environmental regulations in releasing pollutants into or nearby bodies of water in Texas, a state environmental agency found.

item.title: UBS smashes second quarter profit expectations as Credit Suisse consolidation boosts revenue
item.description: Analysts expected revenue of $11.5 billion, according to an LSEG poll.

item.title: Great earnings have these stocks firing

item.title: Large money managers have to disclose their investments. Here‚Äôs how to find them.
item.description: 13-F filings allow anyone to see into the portfolios of the largest institutional investment managers ‚Äî but you should take them with a grain of salt.

item.title: Texas judge who owned Tesla stock recuses himself in Elon Musk's X case against advertisers
item.description: U.S. District Judge Reed O'Connor in Texas has recused himself from X's case against the World Federation of Advertisers.

item.title: France's 'Olympic truce' ends, returning political tensions to the fore
item.description: Emmanuel Macron must appoint a new prime minister but faces an "unprecedented" backdrop that may lead to deadlock.

item.title: Major players are buying puts. Why?
item.description: *sponsored by We haven‚Äôt seen this since the-pandemic-that-shall-not-be-named. My trading partner Taiku pointed something out to me Tuesday that really opened my eyes to what‚Äôs going on in the markets. Yeah, we had a big sell-off earlier this week and the VIX spiked. But that‚Äôs not the real story‚Ä¶ the VIX gradually went back down [‚Ä¶]

item.title: ‚ÄòHe doesn‚Äôt want to help‚Äô: My mother took out a student loan during her marriage. Is my stepfather on the hook?
item.description: ‚ÄúMy stepfather has declared bankruptcy.‚Äù

item.title: Why Wall Street thinks Brian Niccol is the person to revive Starbucks ‚Äî and end the Howard Schultz era
item.description: Starbucks tapped Brian Niccol as its latest CEO, effective Sept. 9, after sales slumped under Laxman Narasimhan.

item.title: UBS CEO says it's too early to talk about a U.S. recession, but a slowdown is possible
item.description: UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti said market volatility could intensify in the second half of the year, but he does not believe the U.S. is heading into a recession.

item.title: How to invest so volatility doesn‚Äôt mess with your financial security
item.description: Take the long view and manage your debt.

item.title: Top Republicans call on Trump to stop insulting Harris, refocus on policy
item.description: Donald Trump has been working to pivot his campaign to attack the new Democratic nominee, Kamala Harris, instead of his prior opponent, President Joe Biden.

item.title: Poland received German request to arrest suspect in Nord Stream probe
item.description: Poland has received a European arrest warrant issued by Berlin in connection with the 2022 attack on Nord Stream pipelines, Polish prosecutors told Reuters.
